newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-ROMA'S DAHLIN MAY MOVE BACK TO BORUSSIA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ROMA'S DAHLIN MAY MOVE BACK TO BORUSSIA.

text.p: Swedish international striker Martin Dahlin may move back to Borussia Moenchengladbach after asking to part ways with Roma, the Italian news agency ANSA said on Wednesday.

It said contacts between Dahlin's manager and a Roma official with the German club had been opened after the player told the serie A side's chairman Franco Sensi that he was not interested in a switch to Glasgow Rangers of Scotland.
The agency quoted a senior Roma official as saying "the deal could be sewn up in the next few hours".
Dahlin moved to Roma from Borussia in the summer on a three-year contract but has hardly played a full match since. He asked to be put on the transfer list last week.
"I'm sorry. I wanted to play for Roma but the coach thinks differently," Dahlin told ANSA.
Roma were not available for comment on the reported move.
